title: Bureaucrats reprimanded for posts about typography
content:
Uh oh. To all those who post to Typophile from work: Bureaucrats at the Japanese Agriculture Ministry have been [reprimanded](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075919/http:/ap.google.com/article/ALeqM5iwJBkcdSu5C4_x_dcIwSpP0TZ6IwD8S36P6O1) for posting to Wikipedia about “typographical mistakes on billboard signs” (?!).

 [‹ website name](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075919/http:/typophile.com/node/37369 "Go to previous forum topic") [Information on univers ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075919/http:/typophile.com/node/37884 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Gus Winterbottom

comments.content: “Hey Bob, we’ve noticed that you tend you think about things non-work related. It’s as if you have some sort of ’life’ outside of work. This is unacceptable.”

<cite>“The Agriculture Ministry is not in charge of Gundam,” said ministry official Tsutomu Shimomura.</cite>

I’m going to be really jealous if I find out Japan actually has a Ministry of Gundam.

I’d agree with reprimanding Bureaucrats who post comments about typography. They should stick to Britny and Paris Hilton videos, chain letter emails and cute animal pics.

R
